column2: or Dillingen an der Donau (Dillingen on the Danube) is a town in Swabia
column4: Germany. It is the administrative center of the district of Dillingen.

column1: Schretzheim is notable for its 6th to 7th century Alemannic cemetery

column1: The counts of Dillingen ruled from the 10th to the 13th century; in 1258 the territory was turned over to the Prince Bishops of Augsburg. After the Reformation
column2: the prince-bishops of Augsburg moved to the Catholic city of Dillingen and made it one of the centers of the Counter-Reformation.

column10: Moreau forced Kray to abandon Ulm and withdraw into eastern Bavaria.A university was established in 1549
column11: but was closed by Napoleon in 1804. The philosophical and theological faculties still existed in the 20th century. In 1971
column13: it became a part of the Bavarian Center for the Education and Training of Teachers and Personnel Management (Akademie für Lehrerfortbildung und Personalführung). One of the largest employers in the city is Bosch and Siemens Household Appliances
